paper_abstract: A k-colouring of a graph G=(V,E) is a mapping c:V ->{1,2,aEuro broken vertical bar,k} such that c(u)not equal c(v) whenever uv is an edge. The reconfiguration graph of the k-colourings of G contains as its vertex set the k-colourings of G, and two colourings are joined by an edge if they differ in colour on just one vertex of G. We introduce a class of k-colourable graphs, which we call k-colour-dense graphs. We show that for each k-colour-dense graph G, the reconfiguration graph of the a""-colourings of G is connected and has diameter O(|V|(2)), for all a""a parts per thousand yenk+1. We show that this graph class contains the k-colourable chordal graphs and that it contains all chordal bipartite graphs when k=2. Moreover, we prove that for each ka parts per thousand yen2 there is a k-colourable chordal graph G whose reconfiguration graph of the (k+1)-colourings has diameter I similar to(|V|(2)).
paper_title: Reconfiguration graphs for vertex colourings of chordal and chordal bipartite graphs
